Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: You feel skeevy and dirty when you do it. But you do it anyway and you change it back as soon as you can, because you don’t want to start getting the Republican mailings,
Unnamed Group of People.Name of Source: Democrats who switch party registration to vote in Republican primaries
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: context of discussing party-switching tactics used by some Democrats to influence Republican primaries

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Most people don’t want to dive into those type of discussions, They respect you for what you do, how you work.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: context of discussing the general attitude towards politics in the community

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Last winter, dozens of locals gathered outside to honk and cheer as one Democrat left town.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: context of discussing community support for a local Democrat

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Nationwide, Democrats account for fewer than 3% of voters in three counties this year, up from one county in 2020 but down from seven in 2016.
Document Sources.Source Justification: context of providing nationwide election data for comparative analysis

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Associated Press election data, Niobrara County’s Democrats, who account for just 2.6% of registered voters, are the most outnumbered by Republicans in the 30 states that track local party affiliation.
Document Sources.Source Justification: context of providing specific election data for Niobrara County

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Normally I just roll my eyes and walk away because I’m fighting a losing battle and I’m fully aware of that, Maybe that is why I’m well-liked, because I keep my mouth shut 10 times more than I want to.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing her experiences as a Democrat in a predominantly Republican area

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: I am who I am, and I have the views that I have, And I don’t care if it bothers people or not.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing her commitment to her political views

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: How far are they going to go to limit one’s ability to vote? If it really comes down to purifying the party, on a voting level all the way up to the elected officials, pretty soon there isn’t going to be anyone left who’s pure enough to be in the party.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing his criticism of the new voting law

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The best way to participate in meaningful change is to try to sway the dominant party, You know, we need to have a government that serves the people, all of them, not just Republicans and not just rural and not just urban and not just Democrats — and definitely not just the rich and the wealthy.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing his reasons for registering as a Republican despite holding left-leaning views

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Most people don’t want to dive into those type of discussions, They respect you for what you do, how you work.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing how locals interact with him despite knowing his political views

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Party-switching had undermined the sanctity of Wyoming’s primary process,
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing the rationale behind the new voting law

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Wyoming Legislature, where the GOP controls over 90% of the seats, passed legislation last year banning voters from changing their party registration in the three months before the August primary.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: context of discussing the passage of the new voting law

Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: context of disclosing funding sources for election coverage
